::Striker::

Striker chuckles, realizing that he was in a rather strange position 
to be doing the chuckling. His scanners were recording as much data 
as possible on the chip, and he needed just a bit more time.

"Respect or not," Striker says calmly, "Ramulus won't go to you 
without preparation, no matter who you have hostage. I've worked with 
the bot, I know him. I can lead him to you."

His eyes narrow, looking at Prebon, "All I ask is that you let her go 
with me. Its up to you. You can either have Ramulus, or us two."



--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, logomorph@h... wrote:
> ::Spears::
> 
> She looked at Striker and raised her voice to him,"YOU WILL SHOW 
> RESPECT TO MY MASTER!  You are in no postion to make demands here." 
> she snapped.  She looked at Prebon, "I serve you now.  You do not 
> need him for anything. Let the worthless bot go.  I shall stay and 
> serve you master." She stood next to Prebon and smiled at him. "I 
> shall please you now master."
> 
> She hoped that her show would convince Prebon.  But it killedher to 
> talk like that to Striker.  She had to force herself to smile as 
> nicely as posable at Prebon.  She hoped that he would let Striker 
> free.
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, Yanshosh@a... wrote:
> > ::Striker::
> > 
> > Striker shakes his head. "Not so fast. I don't leave without 
> Spears, 
> > and unless you free both of us, you arn't getting Ramulus either."
> > 
> > He wasn't about to leave without Spears, and he hoped Prebon 
would 
> > see that. His scanners were busy figuring out how the chip worked 
> as 
> > he talked. He looks back at Prebon.
> > 
> > "Well, what's your decition?"
> >
